website_summaries.verdict: A double stroller for active parents of two young kids.
pros: It's lightweight and easy to maneuver despite being a double stroller
Multiple recline options with 5-point safety harness
cons: Hard to fold and takes up a lot of trunk space

customer_reviews.title: Great for Exercise & outdoors but  not everday use.
customer_reviews.text: Great for walking/running. Beautiful stroller! Kids love it. Very comfy! Fits my 1 year old & 5 year old. It is really bulky. Hard to transport and bring through door ways. You can not go in reverse! Weighs 50 lbs. I can lift it but my mother in law could not. Takes up entire back seat in my Ford Edge SUV. Great for exercise and outdoors. Would not recommend for everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: The Bells

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: amazing stroller!!! bottom baskets have so much room, removable bars, pushes with ease!
customer_reviews.author: Elisa Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller. I used to have a single Bob stroller for my first child but now that I have twins, I think it will be too expensive to purchase a double Bob stroller. To me there is no difference between the 2 just the brand. They both feel very smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Move On & Buy Another Stroller
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, trays for each child, fits in a small car. Design is ideas for perfectly smooth surfaces, not sidewalks. The front wheels shake uncontrollably and the retaining nuts loosen up. Thighten them too much and the wheel will not turn. It’s a wicked catch 22. Finally lost a nut and retaining plate. Called customer service and the guy could not help me based off the model number alone when I called from my car. Upon customer service realizing I did not have a serial number, the guy promptly hung up. I would recommend any stroller but this one.
customer_reviews.author: wrathofthelamb

customer_reviews.title: Decent Stroller Backed by Laughably Bad Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: This stroller arrived without front wheels. When we called the manufacturer to complain, they blamed Amazon, telling us they weren't responsible for what happens to the product in Amazon's warehouse! After being passed around from person to person on the phone they finally told us that they'd make an exception and send us temporary plastic replacements even though we hadn't registered the warranty. We still haven't received the permanent metal wheels they promised. I couldn't believe how they refused to acknowledge responsibly for parts missing on a brand new item they manufactured! The stroller is nice, but dealing with this issue has been so frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: David Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Practically perfect
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is AMAZING! Very easy to maneuver, balanced with children of differing weights (by 30 pounds) and has great storage. The adjustment on the angle of the seats is a little weird but functional. It folds up so easily. It is a little on the big side folded but its a roomy double stroller so I think that just goes with the territory. I love the built in cup holders and cubby. I dont use the MP3 player but the covered cubby for your phone and keys is wonderful. It also rides very smoothly. Would recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang for your Buck!
customer_reviews.text: Great stroller for the price. I bought the stroller through Amazon warehouse and the box arrived missing two front wheels. Baby Trend's customer service was superb and quickly remedied the problem for free (even though it wasn't their error). As for the stroller, there is plenty of room for each kid (3 1/2, 18 month). We use it ALL the time. The front wheels are a little annoying. However if you lock them the wobbling goes away. Sure it makes it harder to run if you're making a lot of turns, but at least I get a better workout 😁
customer_reviews.author: mattat777

customer_reviews.title: Really happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Likes: • sturdy • smooth & comfortable ride for kids • shade can be adjusted to follow sun • good storage under seats • nice wide handle • maneuvers very well • not too heavy to push Dislikes: • hard to fold • heavy to carry • doesn’t fit through doors
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, big, works well for walks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I have a BT infant car seat, and wanted to push my 2 year old and newborn around for walks. I agree with previous reviews that it is HEAVY and very wide. I'm a fairly athletic person and it's heavy. It barely fits in the back of my 2015 Subaru Forester, but it will fit if I pack t a certain way. Regardless, my boys love it. I like that they have their own trays and canopies. It maneuvers okay, purely because of its bulk. We walk on mostly asphalt and doubt we'll take it on the trails.
customer_reviews.author: alamanna

customer_reviews.title: Horrible stroller do not buy it!
customer_reviews.text: when I first used this stroller, I really liked it. It is roomy, has great straps for securing babies, easy to stroll, liked reclining seat option. However, after just a few months of use it started acting up-front wheels are shaking so bad making a ride impossible. My babies hate riding on it so we will have to buy another stroller
customer_reviews.author: MilaSapa

customer_reviews.title: Got this so we can go on walks/runs with our 2 under 2
customer_reviews.text: My 1.5 YO daughter's favorite stroller. She loves being able to sit next to her newborn brother when we go on walks. It fits in our car but we need to take the wheels off to do so. Luckily the wheels come off and on quickly and flawlessly. We have gone to the park multiple times with it and it has been great. It is about the width of a sidewalk so be careful not to fall off the edge.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: I have a serious issue with this stroller.
customer_reviews.text: We loved this stroller for probably the fist 20 miles we put on it, folded it and kept it indoors when not in use. Then, suddenly, the folding mechanism has become non functioning and it no longer folds..which means we keep it outside, in a shed, and can't take it anywhere. It's great for sidewalks, but really wouldn't it be nice to be able to travel with it? Anyone have any suggestions on why the folding mechanism stopped working, and what we can do? I'd love to be able to use this somewhere other than around my house. Help!
customer_reviews.author: EmTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great, but...
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this stroller is awesome. It has plenty of storage beneath seats, snack trays for both kids, sun visors that move to diff positions easily, and storage space for the parent/caregivers drinks/keys/phone. The only complaint I have, is that as soon as we used the stroller we noticed one of the front wheels continues getting stuck. We thought maybe it needed wd40 but that did not help. It usually works ok, but when turning it will get stuck and you have to jiggle the whole stroller a bit. Overall, good stroller
customer_reviews.author: Ky B

customer_reviews.title: Constant tire issues.
customer_reviews.text: The tires are literally the worst to pump up! It wouldn’t be such a big deal but the tires flatten so quickly, that it’s a total pain to own this stroller!! Try juggling two crazy toddlers and you go to take them for a walk and the tires are flat.. AGAIN. And good luck pumping these tires up- they’re completely designed the wrong way... so finding a pump that will pump the tire and be able to unscrew the pump without releasing all the tire air is almost impossible. Good luck and god speed with this stupid stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Moss

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but perfect for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Love this thing. Speakers are scrap but I always have my Bluetooth speaker with me. Just remember, lock the wheels when u run. Don't listen to these people saying they wobble...they don't know they have to lock the wheels when you jog or run.
customer_reviews.author: Joe McCloud

customer_reviews.title: One car seat snapped in really good and tight
customer_reviews.text: When recived, we tried to snap in the the 2 car seats. One car seat snapped in really good and tight, where as the other side did not. After switching car seats and narrowing the problem down, the part on the stroller that snaps in the car seat was not working properly on the stroller. Emailed the seller, and seller is shipping out a new part to hopefully fix this issue. The stroller is kinda on the bigger side. It was expected to be big as it holds 2 children, but it is a bit larger than imagined. Other than that it seems good!
customer_reviews.author: Susie Magdaleno

customer_reviews.title: Super Stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was super simple, I was able to easily put it together myself. Tires had air in them straight out of the box (huge plus for me). Our 14 month old fits great and our 1 month old's infant seat fits great! It's a bit on the heavy side for me. Rolls evenly and smoothly while running with both our toddler and infantin the seat. And just the same with one or the other. Took it shopping in the mall - all the compartments were great and I was surprised it fit through 95% of the isles. Have only found one door it didn't through. Hubby loves the built-in speakers!!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love Baby Trend strollers. Replaced my one seater with this double. It's bigger and heavier, but what do you expect. Fits in the back of my Sienna with the 3rd row still up. Smooth ride, wheels lock for jogging. I expect many miles with my 2 littles.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller but it’s BIG
customer_reviews.text: Perfect double stroller for walks; outside lol. It is smooth and stylish but very VERY big. It does fit through standard doorways, but you have to go very slow and may scratch your door if it isn’t opened ALL THE WAY. fits 2 Baby Trend Car seats perfectly and they sit up nice and high. It is heavy so lifting it to get it into a trunk is a challenge for me. It’s doable but I have to use all of my strength. This is not really practical for daily life (loading kids in and out of the car). Definitely worth the money if you’re looking for a stroller for parks, jogs, the zoo, or anywhere with tons of space.
customer_reviews.author: Eboni Mobley

customer_reviews.title: All the great features at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: I have obsessed over which double stroller would be the best since i was pregnant with my second. I went through numerous single strollers and had a long list of needs. This stroller is super easy to push and maneuver. My oldest has to have a tray and it allows to connect car seats. I have a graco car seat that clicks in! Speakers have a cheap sound, but I mean they still project the sound as you want. Shades are moveable and seats recline. Only negative - the wheels shake a lot when hitting a bump or while jogging.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy L

customer_reviews.title: Love this stroller!
customer_reviews.text: I searched high and low for the best stroller for my two boys (3 and 1). I do not regret my decision in purchasing this stroller because it is PERFECT! It strolls over the broken sidewalks of Portland, Unphased by potholes or bumpy concrete. I take this stroller running through muddy walking trails. Take this stroller to the beach. It is easy to fold up and my 3 foot 6 inch three year old has plenty of room to stretch out and enjoy the rides. Good price compared to others I found with not as many as the awesome features. Overall, I just really love this stroller!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for about 3 months now. The stroller is nice quality, easy to wash and has a nice storage compartment with 2 cup holders. I love this stroller because it's a smooth ride for the kids on our gravel road. I gave it 3 stars for maneuverability because it doesn't fit through our front door that is 36" wide, I had to fold it up to get it outside after assembling it. (This is good to know if you're taking it out shopping)
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: TOO HEAVY
customer_reviews.text: Heavy. Hard to push. Pulls to heavy child side. Because of two wheels in front, weight is pulled to heavier child side so the stroller is pulled to one side. Also stroller itself was a lot heavier than actual double jogging strollers, so going up hill was very difficult. We chose this one at first for the trays. Could not find a double jogging stroller with trays and individual covers for the same price. But it’s not worth how much strain it put on me to push. Huge difference to single front wheel double stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s no Bob, but a great stroller for the price
customer_reviews.text: I like the shape and look of it, it rolls well and handles very easily. But it seems short on leg room and is bouncy, but I was too cheap to buy a double Bob so I can’t really complain. One thing I really dislike is how it folds: the inside of the stroller is on the outside after folded. I am looking at buying a cover for it when we fly so it doesn’t get destroyed. Overall it’s a great stroller for the price, it’s just not a Bob.
customer_reviews.author: H. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This stroller has been amazing. It's been pushed on trails, in stores, sidewalks, over bumps and I don't have reallu any complaints. I'm pretty small, so picking it up and putting it the back of my vehicle can be a little bit of a struggle but it's manageable. I love that each side has separate canopies, separate trays and recline separately. It allows each child to sit as they choose. It's still going strong and doesn't show any issues with wear yet.
customer_reviews.author: jess87

customer_reviews.title: Love this stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this stroller. Works great on almost all terrains, even pavement (which my previous double stroller did horrible on). It is a bit heavy, but not noticeable when pushing it, only when lifting it in and out of a vehicle. I remove the back tires whenever I load it into my caravan to make it easier to store it (very easy to pop on and off). Admittedly I don't jog with it though.
customer_reviews.author: krystal c

customer_reviews.title: 110% Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this stroller. It maneuvers PERFECTLY. The all terrain tires are wonderful and can go from rocks and dirt to side walk and grass! Both seats recline individually so while my 3 year old can take a nap, my 6 month old can sit up and play with the toys on his tray. Also the mp3 speaker attached to the cupholders is an added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Stone

customer_reviews.title: STRANDED A MILE FROM HOME DUE TO A WHEEL BEARING
customer_reviews.text: Overall the stroller is a great cheaper option if you’re not willing to spend $600+ on a stroller. A lot of room and great storage. Handles well although a little heavy. One big con....I’ve used this stroller for less than 6 months and I got stranded a mile from home as one of the wheel bearings went out. I had to push this thing home on its back wheels with both of my kids in it, partially up hill. NOT at all impressed. Ordered a new bearing and it doesn’t work as the entire wheel needs to be replaced. Can’t find a replacement wheel anywhere. Hopefully their customer service is good or I’ll update the star rating to 1.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Thoma

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy but still love it.
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is amazing but super heavy. I have a hard time lifting it, period. But it’s roomy, I have twins and one requires oxygen. There is plenty of room for his medical needs and for them both to be comfortable. I love the color and maneuverability. I can not get the speakers to work but I am not worried about that enough to bother with returning it. Over all we love the stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2micromiracles

customer_reviews.title: Good Stroller!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Baby Trend single jogging stroller and I was so happy with it I decided to buy the double after I had baby #2. The quality is great and it fits in my 2016 Honda Civic which was one of the most important features in deciding which jogging stroller I wanted. It was very easy to assemble and not too heavy when loading and unloading it into the trunk of my car. This stroller is great for jogging and any other outdoor activity. I would not recommend using it in stores because it will not fit through a regular door except when folded up. I am very happy and satisfied with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I use this to take my daughter and the baby I watch on walks/runs. It’s durable and has cup holder/snack tray (which was a must). It’s big! But it fits in our Ford Focus trunk. It’s a *little* cumbersome to open and close, the tray scrapes around on the ground...but it’s a minor “flaw”. Seems comfy for the kids. If you are walking quite fast or jogging, the Front wheels really do need to be locked or they will wobble quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: So Smooth
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous after reading some reviews, but this stroller is great! It rides super smooth. Took me 30 minutes to put together. It fits through my front door, but probably won't fit through a bedroom 3' door. I don't know why other buyers are disappointed in that...You're trying to get two kids side by side.. that's just how it's going to be. It is also super easy to turn if you unlock the front wheels. (I saw some negative reviews about this as well). Anyways, it's AMAZING for the price. If you want top of the line, you are going to pay over $500.
customer_reviews.author: keith a wells

customer_reviews.title: We love this stroller
customer_reviews.text: We love this stroller! Pushes very nicely. If you are doing any jogging or running make sure to lock the front wheels or they will wobble. It has plenty of storage and maneuvers nicely for its size. My only complaint is that it is too big to fit through most doors but I was aware of that before purchase. Doesn't bother us very much as it was bought for walks around town and on the local river walk, not for indoor use.
customer_reviews.author: Mal

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit through most doorways
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this does not fit through all doorways. I love it on walks outside. It has the mobility of a jogger which is great. It also fits the infant car seat which was what we were looking for at the time. However, I have been very disappointment as I have taken it on several outings and have not been able to fit through doors. We are purchasing a different double stroller as a result.
customer_reviews.author: amlync

customer_reviews.title: Great for the first year
customer_reviews.text: GREAT initially, but it does not age well. Mine doesn’t maneuver very smoothly now, the tires keep going flat, and it won’t fold closed anymore (and probably ever again 😩). Luckily it can fit in the back of my minivan while open if I need it to, but I’m super disappointed that I can’t close it. I don’t always want to walk in my neighborhood, so being able to throw it in the back of a vehicle was so nice. I bought this when I was pregnant with our second (a year ago) and now I’m pregnant with our third and I’m considering selling it. I loved it when it was good, but it didn’t last long that way.
customer_reviews.author: David Morse

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for two. Especially for infant/toddler combo
customer_reviews.text: BEST double stroller. I have a VERY small trunk and it fits in easy. Easy to open and close which is major when you're in a hurry. Lots of space for each kid. As well as lots of basket storage space below. We use the baby trend infant seat with this for a few months until our second child was big enough to sit in the seat alone and the car seat fit in this perfectly and held it securely in place. My 3 year old fit in it nicely without hanging out which was our biggest issue when trying to find a double stroller. No complaints here. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great ride
customer_reviews.text: We have the single ride for our 2 yr old and when had 2nd son bought the two seater. The speakers absolutely suck and the front wheels shake a bit unless you lock them but then it is hard to maneuver. Hoping we will work out the kinks with the wheels. Love the color snd it is roomy. Definitely fits our carseat better than single rider. It is HEAVY.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Some trouble with doors but WORTH IT!
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller! Trouble going through the door at our house but worth it! I’m 5’8 and a lot of the strollers I’ve tried have had such short handles for pushing but this one is at the perfect height. My kids aren’t shaken all over the place if we’re on uneven ground and it is very easy to turn.
customer_reviews.author: Perry Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Perfect for us
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Wish there was a snack try option though. Arrived quick. Tires inflated. All pieces. Easy to put together. Rolls so easy. Kids love it. Pretty bulky but it's a double after all. Fits through my hallways and doorways and I'm my car and everywhere I go. No issue whatsoever
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Great double for the price
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller!! It fits my 3year old and 9 month old perfect. Rolls great and is easy to push. Handle bar is nice and tall so no bending down (I'm 5'11) the only issues I have with it, the tires came pretty flat (an easy fix) the trays are pretty hard to open, but hoping with time they get looser. Over all for the price you can't beat it. I also got it on sale!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great twin stroller! We love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great stroller, we had another more expensive twin stroller and the only thing that was better was that it was not as wide but honestly, this one is really good quality and perfect for outdoors. Our girls are smaller (11-12lbs at 4months) and they fit in it perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: F.R. Estes

customer_reviews.title: Very wide.
customer_reviews.text: It’s too wide to fit through doors & has no tray or cup holder for my kids. I can’t bring it inside stores or anything because it is significantly larger than most door frames. I can’t even fit it through the door in my house without breaking it down and bringing it in. That’s the only downside to this stroller though the width & the lack of trays. Other than that, it’s a pretty great stroller. Lots of room for both my kids and Very smooth ride.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddler and infant
customer_reviews.text: Love this double stroller. Works great for my toddler and new baby. I needed something that I could put my infant car seat on and use with my toddler. I have a Graco seat and it fits perfectly. It is a little heavy and big but that’s to be expected with any double stroller. It pushes and glides great. It was easy to put together and didn’t take me very long at all.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Parts falling off on first jog. Big and bulky.
customer_reviews.text: Very bulky when folded and heavy to move. Nuts and washers and special nonsensical pieces started falling off on the first jog. I will have to find part replacements because it doesn’t work and I’ve used it once. The canopies do not cover what the pictures indicated. When the stroller is open it will not fit through any doorway except sliding glass or French doors. You better have a good amount of room in your for this thing, because it’s an Albatross. If given the opportunity, I would’ve purchased something else.
customer_reviews.author: Music Nerd

customer_reviews.title: Over all ok but fairly cheap.
customer_reviews.text: This stroller serves its purpose for me. I am able to take both kids for long walks, and for the price that's great. But overall the stroller feels pretty cheap. The trays and cup holders feel like cheap plastic and I doubt it will be long before they break. One of the front wheels was slightly higher than the other so it's off the ground when there's no weight in it. Once the kids are in it, it works alright. The speakers don't seem to work with my phone (iPhone 6) but I didnt buy it for that do I don't really care. I have a Agra I single stroller that seems to be a much higher quality stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: So this may have been my fault, but it does not come with a cup holder for the child. And the spot where the feet go is very small and he just dangles them off the side. I wanted to love this stroller because we have all baby trend strollers and now since having a newborn and 3 yr old, needed a double. But this stroller is not as nice as my sister in laws who had the same brand of double stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah Lee

customer_reviews.title: Flawed tire
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stroller to take granddaughters to zoo. Product arrived in timely manner. Aired the tires as recommended then took a stroll in neighborhood for test run. Right rear tire appeared to have lost some air. Put more aIraq in. While at the zoo, had to continuously air it up. Luckily I had packed the pump. Was more of a nuisance. Pretty disappointed I have to now deal with getting replacement tire and took me two months to settle on purchasing this double stroller. Cannot give fair evaluatation on the maneuvering due to problems with the tire. Had plenty of room to store coolers under seats and children sat comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Good but beware or front wheel locking up
customer_reviews.text: The stroller is a great price, easy to use, a little heavy, but it’s the second time we bought it. The first time one of the front wheels locked up during a trip to the zoo. It made the last half of the visit long and frustrating. We bought it again thinking we’d have the same problem but justified it because the price and amount of use we got out of it for 2 years outweighed the potential problem again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect double stroller jogger
customer_reviews.text: Graco click connect will fit in it and it’s perfect for two kiddos on any and every kid of walk/run. Also definitely glad I got the one with dual canopies as the canopy with the car seat doesn’t go over it since it isn’t the right brand but my son can still use his and the canopy moves so if the sun is at a different angle the canopy can move forward
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Sell

customer_reviews.title: Love this stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller. I bought the single version of this and after I had my second baby I HAD to get the double. It’s just the same but bigger! I love that each child has their own cup holders and tray and their own canopy. Also a nice bonus was that the bottom of the stroller had each a decent size basket. The only downside is the weight of the stroller. It is super heavy to lift into and out of any vehicle
customer_reviews.author: Carlie

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, but maneuverable
customer_reviews.text: This is really a great product. Unfortunately, it doesn't fit through standard doors when I have a carseat in either of the seats, which is a real bummer, for me. It's also quite heavy. It is quite maneuverable, though, and when I just want it for going around the neighborhood or to the park, I couldn't ask for better. It's just not perfect for everything that I would like to use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Poynter

customer_reviews.title: Lays very flat for newborn
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller for newborn and 3 year old! It lays flatter than any other stroller we have I feel comfortable putting a newborn in without a car seat. Chicco keyfit does fit but doesn’t lock in at all. Fits through a 36” door but not a 34”.
customer_reviews.author: Tracie Thorp

customer_reviews.title: Tires SUCK
customer_reviews.text: Love the stroller but the tire will not stay pumped. I have to pump it everyday I go for a walk. Trying to find a way to get a replacement. Front tire and left tire won’t stay inflated.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This was given to a friend's daughter who has two children. It is a sturdy stroller which is very easy to push. With one finger you can easily move it and do a 360 degree turn so easy to bring into a store as well. The big wheels move over any terrain easily. Our sidewalks are not flat and when we used a stroller with smaller wheels, we often had to lift the stroller over bumps in the sidewalk.
customer_reviews.author: james morin

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller!
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy it is to move directions. The speakers, the extra storage and 6 cup holders are a plus. It transitions smoothly from grass to dirt to pavement. I like that it comes with the strap so I don't have to worry about it rolling away as long as I have the strap on my wrist. Also its roomy for my babies. It doesnt fit with the car seat I have but overall it's a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: melissa

customer_reviews.title: A stroller that does not roll....
customer_reviews.text: We bought the stroller in January. At first i thought it was very sturdy and durable. In March the wheel got stuck. The stroller wouldn't move forward. My husband had to drag the stroller backwards with my two sons in. I had told him to return it but he insisted on keeping it. He got the replacement wheel in April. It appeared that it was the wheel bearing that broke. A month later (!!!) the wheel broke AGAIN. Same thing. What good does a stroller do when it does not roll??? Do not buy
customer_reviews.author: cindy

customer_reviews.title: Love my stroller!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the hummer of strollers. People are amazed by it! Lol! I love how roomy it is. It’s heavy obviously but it’s no more than I would’ve expected it to be. Very sturdy and the color is great! The only issue I’ve had is that it’s hard to get through doorways when we go places.
customer_reviews.author: ShelbbLC

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge! But works great for my newborn and toddler. Moves easy. Plenty of room for kids and bottom storage. Even has storage on top. Only issue is how bulky it is. You need a large trunk, and some muscle lol. But that’s to be expected for the size.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: It does not fit through a doorway
customer_reviews.text: This thing is roomy and comfy for my kiddos. I love that it reclines nearly flat and the built in speakers actually work. I haven’t “jogged” with it so I can’t speak to the speed wobbles but it maneuvered fairly well at the park. The only negative is that it does not fit through anything besides a double door without a center pole. It is nearly impossible for a single person to get this thing into a building.
customer_reviews.author: Maryhtc

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: every stroller I have ever received was used so this was my first brand new buy and I love it! my kids enjoy it and it is easy to steer. was easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Sky L.

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about buying it with reviews of not fitting in the vehicles. I love this stroller. Yes it is a bit bulky but you have to remember it is a double. I am able to fit it in the back of my mini van. We took it on vacation with us and I was able to put it and 2 medium sides suitcases in the back of my van. Also a plus is the child trays.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Amazing stroller!
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to assemble, easy to use, easy to fold, and my kids LOVE going for rides! I got this stroller when my 4th child was born and wish I would have gotten it when I had my other kids instead of waiting. The seats recline far enough that it works well for my 1 month old. The storage baskets are sufficient and the trays and built in speaker are added bonuses!
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: It takes some effort
customer_reviews.text: The first time we went out with this was the worst but I think my husband and I have mastered it. When you assemble make sure to fully tighten the front wheels or they will do this awful shaking thing when you go over bumps or try to run. The wheels for us need to be re-pumped more often than I would like as well and it is quite hard because the spokes are so close to the pumping thing.
customer_reviews.author: Lara Bell

customer_reviews.title: Love this stroller. ..
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller. I have a 3 year old and a 6 years old but she is pretty skinny. They both love to be in the stroller. We used it for trips to disneyland and it's just great. It's BIG and spacious. They can laid-back almost flat. The basket and storage bags are perfect. It is bulky, but a great product. My husband calls it "The Monstrosity " but we like the fact that our kids are very confortable.
customer_reviews.author: Roque R Minaya

customer_reviews.title: Awesome under perfect circumstances.
customer_reviews.text: Ok I really do want to love this stroller, however the tires get flat in about two seconds and the front right wheel keeps coming off. Its a dream to steer, collapses easily and the speaker is a nice touch. But these wheels are just a PITA. Does not fit in the trunk of my Ford Flex standing up or with one seat down which is a no-go since we have three carseat kids.
customer_reviews.author: JillyJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Stroller
customer_reviews.text: Great stroller but very large...obviously! Folded up this WILL NOT fit in the back end of our 2013 Traverse with back seats up. This was a huge disappointment for us. It does push easily and is easy to deploy and fold. Be prepared as it is quite heavy so getting this into the back end of a vehicle will be a struggle for some. Good quality and kids are comfortable. Speakers are a little hokey. Good storage underneath. Plenty of room for a diaper bag, purse and other.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. I

customer_reviews.title: Get this and skip the super expensive joggers
customer_reviews.text: Its pretty light weight for a jogging double stroller. Defiantly has plenty of leg room for each kid. Doesn't feel off balance even though my children are 20 lbs apart. It absorbs the rough roads pretty well too!
customer_reviews.author: Grace paxton

customer_reviews.title: So heavy and broke within 6 months!
customer_reviews.text: Pro- comfortable for the two Kids to ride in. Cons- super heavy and bulky, awkward to fold and lift, takes up the entire trunk, expensive Ours doesn’t fold after 6 months and the front wheels are funky.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller
customer_reviews.text: Great, Great stroller. Just wish it would fit through doorways
customer_reviews.author: mom-of-three

customer_reviews.title: Value for the price
customer_reviews.text: My first jogging stroller. Im not a big runner, but I enjoy taking my 4 young children for walks. I like that I can go "off road" with this stroller and not get stuck in the grass or jolt my littlest girls on bumpy asphalt. Ours arrived with a damaged wheel and the company was fantastic about working with us to resolve the issue quickly. So far I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller!
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller! It’s comfortable for my two little ones and very easy to maneuver. It is large and doesn’t fit in trunks easily, but is great for walks! I did have trouble with a bad tube in a back wheel. They were very nice and sent a replacement for free.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Kong

customer_reviews.title: Works with Greco car seat too!!
customer_reviews.text: The stroller is great! Works with our Greco Click connect car seat! Our boys love the stroller, I gave it 4 stars because there is a bubble in the inner tube or tire on the back right tire. I have contacted Baby trend and will update the review if it is fixed!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Timmermeyer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for walks or trails
customer_reviews.text: If you like to be outdoors with kids a lot than this is the stroller for you. I take my kids on walks all the time and this is perfect on trails or if you want to just walk the neighborhood for a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Kat

customer_reviews.title: Nice jogger
customer_reviews.text: I love the trays on both sides, my girls love having their own space without being side by side. That was the selling point for me. This is quite large but it is also a nice double jogger. It fits about perfect in the back of a kia sorento.
customer_reviews.author: Kcjojo

customer_reviews.title: Big enough for tall toddler
customer_reviews.text: Love having this for my baby and toddler. He is very tall for a 3 yr old (43") and the foot room is a little lacking but it is plenty comfortable for the walks we take. Other double strollers are too small for him to fit or his head is hitting to cover. This one has plenty of head room. Its easy to push but it is pretty heavy and is large. It takes up the whole back of my SUV. It is exactly what i was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: They both fit and it folds up easily. However
customer_reviews.text: I was set on a side by side for my two boys (2.5 and 9 months). They both fit and it folds up easily. However, it's heavy and a BEAST to put into my Explorer. It is also supposed to fit through a standard doorway, but we have had difficulty at multiple places. I recommend it for use in "wide open spaces" but not so much for indoor use. In that case, you'd be better off getting one where the kids go one in front of the other. I wish I had done so.
customer_reviews.author: Kellee

customer_reviews.title: Good stroller
customer_reviews.text: Overall very happy with this stroller. It's easy to maneuver and seems well made. Although it folds easily it's a bit awkward to open up. The built in speakers are worthless!
customer_reviews.author: Holly H.

customer_reviews.title: Great for 2 under 2!
customer_reviews.text: This feels only slightly larger than a single stroller when you push it, but it is much larger when folded up. I wish the baskets below were a little larger or that it was just one since the diaper bag doesn’t quite fit without some muscle. I love that baby trend car seats clip in easily! Overall, super amazing purchase with two under two!
customer_reviews.author: Dakotah Rickert

customer_reviews.title: We love this stroller
customer_reviews.text: We love this stroller. Has everything we need for 6 month old and 3.5 year old to be comfortable for long periods of time, including napping. Also fits easily through standard door frames and for a double stroller with quite a bit of weight in it, it is easy to push and maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Not good for briskly walking/jogging/running. Great for walking
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is great if you are using it for walking, not fast walking regular walking. As soon as it gets any type of speed the front wheels shake. I would not recommend this stroller to anyone who is actually using it to jog/run/briskly walk. It is very hard to turn while jogging and the front wheels are locked and you have two kids in it. Other than that it is a great, roomy stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: the stroller is good for jogging at about a 10 min per mile ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a rather heavy stroller. Without the front wheels locked, it maneuvers well. However, if you walk quickly, the front wheels may shake. If you lock the front wheels, the stroller is good for jogging at about a 10 min per mile pace IF there are not a lot of turns. It's sturdy and has plenty of room for carrying baby cargo. You can take it onto cultivated dirty trails and soccer fields pretty easily but I wouldn't do any real off reading. Overall, my wife is very happy with this stroller.
customer_reviews.author: O. Castillo

customer_reviews.title: This stroller is very nice but is heavy
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is very nice but is heavy, also a huge malfunction of this stroller is the straps that holds each back up in the back of the stroller! It has latches that you can flip over but it's still makes the back of the seats lean wayyy to far back. My kids like to sit up straight and be able to reach the cup holder, I had to put bungee cords and figure out how to make them hold the backs up. Not thought through at alll!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kerri

customer_reviews.title: I would return the stroller if I could!!
customer_reviews.text: I wished I would have taken the negative reviews to heart! The tires and tubes are very cheap. I had a flat tire within the first week of use that slime won't fix. The front wheels wobble and make a horrible sound if you try to jog at all. The design of incline/reclining the seats is horrible - a buckle to try to tighten across the back of the seat to incline and even tightened all the way doesn't get the seat completely upright. The trays are a pain to unlatch as well. The speaker feature might be cool if I had an iPhone but I'd need a special adapter to use my Samsung.
customer_reviews.author: Allison D. York

customer_reviews.title: Really sturdy stroller
customer_reviews.text: I've had this stroller for a year and is still working great. Sturdy, durable, comfortable and spacious for kids. It is heavy though to carry when folded and it remains pretty big after folded. If you do not care much about these two negative features then you will be ok, because everything else is great!. You have plenty of storage, two cups holders for you and cup holders and trays for the babies. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Yusmila

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Works well for 2 . Speakers don’t work good but that’s ok it’s a little cheaply made but that’s ok too only paid 200 and it works as advertised. 4/5 docking one star for quality of materials. Easy to assemble took 30 mins .
customer_reviews.author: FreeSpiritSarita

customer_reviews.title: BROKE 23 DAYS AFTER 90 DAY EXCHANGE PERIOD ENDED - WASTED $170
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on June 14, 2017, last return date September 14, 2017, front tire screw came off October 4, 2017, spent the last 2 days trying to find a replacement screw at various stores (Home Depot, Target Walmart, Ace Hardware) Looked up order to exchange but its 23 days out of the return window. Great when it worked, but a $170 for 3 months of actually usage RIDICULOUS!! We live in So. Cal and I purchased for my girlfriend who has 2 special needs boys after one of the boys got caught in her other double stroller. They were very excited to get this one, but no not so much.
customer_reviews.author: lyle

customer_reviews.title: Great for infant and toddler combo
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great stroller so far. Keep in mind it’s super wide and you might have problems going through certain areas like some doors and maybe a smaller store will give your problems. But I love it. My son is tall and this gives him enough room to wiggle around in. I also have my daughter on the other side who’s newborn and the stroller holds her car seat safely and securely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice jogger! When it arrived it was missing a ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice jogger! When it arrived it was missing a part. A quick call to the manufacturer and they shipped out the missing piece very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Best stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It is the perfect size. My kids love it. I used my Graco snug fit 35 car seat and it clicked in perfectly. Easy to put together too. The visors cover the kids at different angles. I have been using it for a year and never had wheel trouble like other posts. I have had to fill the tires up but that is expected. My skip hop double diaper bag attaches perfectly. I like this one better than other doubles, more room for the kids. They are not on top of each other with leg room. I have used more expensive double strollers and I like this one best!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Way too big and way too heavy.
customer_reviews.text: I am actually in the process of returning this because it is enormous! I can barely lift it and as a mom with 2 children under the age of 2 running errands during the week without my husband I cannot even lift this thing into the trunk of my car. And with that being said it won't even fit in the trunk of my car (2015 Ford Focus). It also will not fit through smaller doorways. It's too wide making it inconvenient to take inside a store. We decided to go with a nice umbrella stroller which is very light and fits easily into the trunk of my car.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great Jogger!
customer_reviews.text: We have gotten into running lately and we needed a double stroller to take with. We found this one and have pretty much fallen in love with it. The moveable sun shades are awesome for when you turn and the sun is now coming from a different direction. The only issue we have is unfolding it. Ours stays open 90% of the time but the times we have to close it and open it back up are extremely annoying. Overall great stroller though!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne V.

customer_reviews.title: A little cheap but works great for the price
customer_reviews.text: A little cheap but works great for the price. Needs a different tube on the front tires though. Had to replace with a tube that had a longer bent stem because we couldn't inflate them with the others.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Marlatt

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller
customer_reviews.text: Great stroller. Works great with my 1 yr old and 5 yr old. Only negative is the front wheel is extremely difficult to inflate. It arrived with all three tires needing air. Back two were easy to pump up, Front, we had quite a bit of trouble since the wheel frame doesn’t leave much room to get the pump nozzle in there.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley S

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I love this jogger! Definitely gives you a workout with 2 kids in it but it moves very smoothly and very easy to fold & unfold. It’s heavy but expected being a double. Nothing I can’t handle myself to get in and out of my SUV though (I’m tall though, 6ft - may be a bit harder for a shorter person). Like the speaker but not great quality - I leave the compartment open for better sound when I use it. Overall I love it though! Would defiantly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: jjrich

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this double jogger
customer_reviews.text: My kids LOVE this stroller. They love the tray because they like to snack while we run. Turns will be wide, but other than that it’s a very smooth stroller ride. Will definitely need tools to put the trays and such on but it’s nothing difficult. Folds up and fits in my Jeep Patriot. Fits very tightly through doors but does fit.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Front wheel shaking .
customer_reviews.text: The product itself seems like a great product except that the front wheel is shaking we regard a replacement in the front wheel was shaking again
customer_reviews.author: Dejan

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great jogging stroller for the price. If you don't expect a ~$160 to have the features of a $600 stroller, you'll be happy with this purchase. My toddler wants to eat his dinner and play with his toys in the think and said it's, "comfy." That's enough for me! Easy to put together, too.
customer_reviews.author: Hudgens Family

customer_reviews.title: Great jogger at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I've had this stroller for over 2 and a half years. It's been great. We've ran countless 5k's using it and visited lots of theme parks. It's held up well. Good cup holders, shade canopy and storage space.
customer_reviews.author: Court

customer_reviews.title: Best Value - Double Jogger
customer_reviews.text: I don't have much experience with double jogger strollers, but for the price, I'm extremely happy with the initial quality and aesthetics of this stroller! It is quite attractive, and fits our Graco infant carseat well.
customer_reviews.author: ChewyL

customer_reviews.title: Great for walks not for high speeds
customer_reviews.text: Great for walking and running. Not so good when rollerblading, very shaky at high speeds. Broke while rollerblading, ordered new parts and now just use it when walking.
customer_reviews.author: Mr deeds

product_meta.title: Baby Trend Navigator Lite Double Jogger Stroller, Candy Apple
product_meta.description: Color:Candy AppleTake your family jogging with the Baby Trend Navigator Lite Double Jogging stroller that can accept two baby trend car seats (sold separately). Made for two children, this jogging stroller features composite tires and a locking front swivel wheel that allows you to keep the front wheel in place while jogging. If you're out for a leisurely stroll, simply unlock the front wheel for greater maneuverability. For your convenience, the parent tray includes two cup holders and covered compartment storage. For your children's comfort and safety, the double jogger features a ratcheting shade canopy, a multi-position reclining seat and an adjustable five-point safety harness. Store your children's necessities in the large storage basket, and you're ready to roll. Know you're traveling safely in this sturdy, lightweight double jogger that's certified by the juvenile products manufacturers association. At the end of your trip, quickly and easily fold the stroller into a compact unit. 46 x 31.5 x 42 recommended use: children up to 50 lbs.
feature_bullets: Accommodates 2 Baby Trend infant Car Seats
Dimensions: 32.5" W x 46" L x 43 H" | Weight: 43 lbs
Locking front swivel wheels, and pneumatic bicycle tires
Convenient parent tray includes two cup holders, MP3 speakers and covered storage compartment
Effortless trigger folding easily collapses the Navigator double for storage and transport

specifications.Style: Baby Trend Navigator Lite Double Jogger Stroller,
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars914 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
